identification.role: Roman enforcement officer, interrogator, administrator of harsh measures; one of the Four Arcani; dehumanized tool of Rome
identification.story_status: Active through Parts 1-3; final state unknown
identification.primary_narrative_function: Dehumanized tool becoming progressively less human through systematic cruelty

physical_description.build: Average to slightly shorter; strong, muscular; maintained through hands-on enforcement work

distinctive_features.eyes: Hardened by years of enforcement; cruel expression; lack of empathy visible
distinctive_features.face: Expression showing permanent anger or contempt
distinctive_features.scars: Scarred extensively; marks of violence throughout body
distinctive_features.bearing: Aggressive; shoulders forward; threatening stance; people instinctively move away from him
distinctive_features.hair: Dark; kept unkempt compared to other officers
distinctive_features.beard: Heavy; doesn't maintain carefully; appearance deliberately intimidating

physical_description.visual_signature: Controlled brutality; effective enforcement; feared; wear shows as psychological strain appears

primary_traits.description: Follows orders without hesitation; reliable tool; never questions commands
Presence creates fear automatically; people instinctively move away; psychological dominance
Excellent at executing assigned elimination tasks; gets results; valued for effectiveness
Can do brutal things while appearing functional; maintains professional appearance despite brutality
Every cruelty costs a piece of humanity; becoming tool while losing human agency

strengths.shows_in: Never questions commands; executes efficiently; trusted by superiors
People instinctively move away; fear precedes his actions; psychological dominance
Gets results; achieves objectives; valued for effectiveness

flaws_and_vulnerabilities.manifestation: Cannot feel deeply; connection impossible; no genuine relationships; isolated
Cannot see implications of actions; doesn't recognize dehumanization; avoids self-awareness
Compartmentalization fragile; if breaks, collapse severe; psychological structure strained
Less human each moment; awareness of this increasing; progressive dehumanization; losing sense of self

core_motivations: Exercise absolute power through fear and cruelty
Systematic elimination of resistance through terror
Coordinate with other Arcani to destroy opposition

relationships.dynamic: Brutus directs; Horatius executes; clear hierarchy; Horatius respects Brutus's control
Corvus identifies targets; Horatius eliminates them; efficient collaboration
Maximus sets strategy; Horatius executes enforcement; strategic coordination

story_arc.opening_state: Controlled brutality; effective enforcement; feared; already dehumanized
story_arc.transformation: Psychological strain visible; compartmentalization breaking; awareness of dehumanization growing
story_arc.closing_state: Either broken and no longer functional, re-hardened more brutally, or defected/turned toward followers

character.why_readers_care: Horatius represents the horrifying cost of being a tool of oppression. His character demonstrates that those who perpetrate systematic cruelty become dehumanized themselves. Readers watch his progressive transformation from efficient enforcer to something increasingly inhuman. His psychological crisis—the breaking down of compartmentalization that allows him to function—creates tension about whether he will reclaim his humanity or lose it completely. Through Horatius, readers see how efficiency in cruelty requires avoiding humanity, but humanity tries to surface.
character_questions_for_readers: Can those who perpetrate cruelty remain human?
What is the cost of being an efficient tool of oppression?
How does systematic dehumanization affect the oppressor?
Can psychological compartmentalization survive constant brutality?
What happens when the tool becomes autonomous?
